messages.title: It's Sarah Carr or the Conservative here
messages.content: Labour, Greens and UKIP cannot win here

messages.title: Sarah Carr set to win
messages.content: Paul Keetch is not standing for re-election in Herefordshire. Paul Keetch is supporting Sarah Carr as the best choice to be our local MP. Paul Keetch and Sarah Carr have a strong record of action which she will continue as our MP.

messages.title: 3 things to remember
messages.content: 1. Sarah Carr has a record of action fighting for local services; scrapping hospital parking charges, fighting for our schools and rural services. 2. The Conservative candidate is a London based ex-banker whose family do not live in Herefordshire. 3. Labour cannot win in Herefordshire. Voting for them will just help the Conservatives win.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fairer taxes that put money back in your pocket
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg's tax plan means that you will pay no tax on the first £10,000 you earn – cutting most tax bills by £700.

mentions.candidate: Sarah Carr is campaigning against outrageous hospital parking charges. She has also led strong campaigns against closures to local schools and local post offices.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour, Greens and UKIP cannot win here. Voting for them will just help the Conservatives win.

issues.education: Sarah Carr has led strong campaigns against closures to local schools
issues.health: Sarah Carr is campaigning against outrageous hospital parking charges

leaflet.personalStatement: She will take to Westminster a sense of integrity that many see as lacking in their elected representatives

endorsements.endorsement: She will take to Westminster a sense of integrity that many see as lacking in their elected representatives

quotes.text: She will take to Westminster a sense of integrity that many see as lacking in their elected representatives

images.caption: Sarah Carr and her family live in Herefordshire.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The Conservative candidate is based in London where his wife and children live. He is a former director of Barclays Bank, which paid out millions in bonuses. He has failed to stand up to the Conservative run Council. They are spending £17m on new offices whilst slashing vital local services.
